====================

### Mayor Craig Morgan

![Headshot of Craig Morgan](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/4x5Morgan_Craig_420-3547-Retouched-retouched.jpg)

[EMAIL CRAIG MORGAN](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYxOTkyMiIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Craig Morgan was elected to serve as Mayor of Round Rock in May 2017. Prior to being elected to his current seat, he served as Councilmember to Place 1 from May 2011 through May 2017, and was selected as Mayor Pro-Tem in June 2016.

Morgan, a Round Rock attorney, has been an active member in the Round Rock community. He currently serves on the St. David’s Round Rock Medical Center Board of Trustees, Capital Area Metropolitan Planning Organization Policy Board (CAMPO) and is a member of the Rotary Club of Round Rock. Additionally, Morgan attends the Fellowship at Forest Creek in Round Rock.

He is a Leadership Round Rock graduate and has previously served on the Round Rock Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors, the Chasco Family YMCA board of directors and the Leadership Round Rock Planning Board. Additionally, Morgan served as a Commissioner on the Round Rock Planning and Zoning Commission, is a former member of the Ridgeview Middle School PTA and served as a member of the Round Rock Charter Review Commission in 2007.

In 2020, Morgan was selected as the Round Rock Chamber’s Citizen of the Year. That same year, he was awarded the Greater Round Rock Community Foundation’s Innovation in Philanthropy Award. He was recognized for these awards for his leadership in spearheading the Round Rock Cares initiative, a public-private partnership to help small businesses at the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Morgan received his undergraduate degree from Texas Tech University, an MBA from Southwest Texas State University (now Texas State University), and his law degree from the University of Tulsa College of Law. He is married to Amanda Morgan and they have one son, Garret.

### Michelle Ly, Place 1

![Michelle Ly](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/HiRes-Michelle_Ly-5194-Edit-1040x1300.jpg)

[EMAIL MICHELLE LY](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYyMjYzNiIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Michelle Ly was elected to serve as Councilmember to Place 1 in November 2020.  
Michelle, along with her husband, founded four local businesses in Round Rock: Hall Roofing and Construction, The Rock Sports Bar, Alcove Cantina and The Flats Round Rock. She has a Bachelors of Business Administration from Southwest Texas State University (now Texas State University) and is a Round Rock High School graduate.

She is an active investor in the Round Rock Chamber of Commerce. She has served on the Chamber’s Board of Directors, is 2016 graduate of Leadership Round Rock and a 2019 graduate of Ascend Emerging Leaders.

Michelle served as a commissioner on the City of Round Rock’s Planning and Zoning Commission and served on the Capital Improvements Advisory Committee. She is currently serving on the CHASCO YMCA Board of Directors. She is an active member of Chaparrals Women’s Club, Professional Women of Williamson County and National Women in Roofing.

Michelle and her husband, Erik Hall, have a daughter, Reagan.

### Rene Flores, Place 2

![Headshot of Rene Flores](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/4x5Flores_Rene_456-3254-Retouched-retouched.jpg)

[EMAIL RENE FLORES](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYyMjY4NiIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Rene Flores was first elected to Place 2 in May 2016 and re-elected in May 2019 and May 2022. He served as Mayor Pro-Tem from December 2020 to June 2023.

Flores works as Vice President-Commercial Lender with Amplify Credit Union and helps commercial real estate customers all over the state of Texas. He received his BBA with a major in Finance from Texas Christian University. Flores is a graduate of Leadership Round Rock and completed five years of service on the Round Rock Chamber board. He served as chair for the Investor Council, worked on the Leadership Round Rock Planning group and served on the Finance Council. Flores was appointed as a Commissioner to the Round Rock Planning and Zoning Commission and served four years prior to his time on the City Council.

He currently serves on the executive board of the Workforce Solutions Rural Capital Area as Treasurer, Round Rock ISD Partners in Education Foundation Board, Central Texas YMCA Board, and serves as Secretary of the Brushy Creek Regional Utility Authority board of directors. Flores previously chaired the Finance Committee for St. William Catholic Church where he and his family attend. He is past president of the Round Rock Rotary Club and currently serves as President of the Transportation and Economic Development Corporation for the City of Round Rock. He completed course work to obtain his economic development certificate from the University of Oklahoma’s Economic Development Institute.

Flores and his wife, Cynthia, have two children Cecelia and John Richard.

### Melissa Fleming, Place 3

![Headshot of Melissa Fleming](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/4x5Fleming_Melissa_435-3578-Retouched-retouched.jpg)

[EMAIL MELISSA FLEMING](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6Ijc0NzQzNyIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Melissa Fleming was elected to Place 3 on May 4, 2024. Melissa is a business and community leader, founder of a non-profit, former business owner, devoted mom, wife and volunteer.

Melissa is a second-generation Texan and grew up in Houston. Melissa earned her Bachelor of Arts in Economics and her Financial Planning Certificate from The University of Texas at Austin. Melissa has lived in the Greater Austin area for 30 years, and in Round Rock for nearly 20 years.

Melissa is a Wealth Advisor with IronBridge Private Wealth and attained her CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ certification and Chartered Financial Consultant® designation. She has been in the financial services sector since 1998. Previous to Ironbridge, she cofounded the Fleming & Conway Allstate Agency in Austin and Round Rock in 2010 managing with her business partner for over 11 years.

Melissa has been an investor of the Round Rock Chamber since 2013, serving as Ambassador Chair, Board Member, Vice Chair on the Leadership Round Rock planning committee, and was awarded 2023 “Investor of the Year.”

Melissa is a member of Professional Women of Williamson County, Rotary Club of Round Rock, Girl Scouts of Central Texas Troop Leader, Director of Austin-Round Rock (Team Brock) Chapter of The Cure Starts Now, Director of Partnerships with The Cure Starts Now, and Strategic Advisory Council of The Cure Starts Now.

Melissa and her husband, James, who is an honorably retired Austin Police Officer, have three children, Jenna, (Brock), and Blair. They have raised over $2MM in honor of their 7-year-old son Brock, who battled DIPG.

### Frank Ortega, Place 4

![](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/Web-Frank_Ortega-5578-Edit.jpg)

[EMAIL FRANK ORTEGA](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYyMjczNiIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Frank Ortega was sworn in on Dec. 3, 2020 following the Nov. 3 election.

Frank is a community and business leader, activist and life-long Texan. Frank grew up all over Texas thanks to his Air Force father, and has called Central Texas his home for more than 34 years. Over the course of his life, Frank has had a long history of political and community engagement. Frank is a current State Board member of the Hispanic Organization for Public Education, Board member of the League of United Latin American Citizens as well the District VIII Director of the League of United Latin American Citizens, a member of the El Amistad Club, a member of the Citizens For Diversity Leadership Role and served on the Lubbock Planning and Zoning Commission.

Ortega has been a Real Estate Agent in Round Rock for years with The AFAustin Team Powered by Keller Williams Realty.

Ortega received his Associate In Applied Arts from Howard College in Big Spring, Texas. Ortega and his wife, Victoria, have a cocker spaniel named Buddy.

### Kristin Stevens, Place 5, Mayor Pro Tem

![](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Kristin_Stevens-6671-Edit.jpg)

[EMAIL KRISTIN STEVENS](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYyMjc0OCIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Kristin Stevens is a native Texan who has proudly called Round Rock home since 1977. Deeply rooted in the community, she has dedicated decades to public service, volunteer leadership, and local engagement. Kristin is currently serving her second term on the Round Rock City Council in Place 5 and is in her second year as Mayor Pro Tem. She also serves as the Mayor’s alternate to the Capital Area Metropolitan Planning Organization (CAMPO).

Kristin’s involvement in community organizations spans many years. She is the former Board Chair of the Chasco Family YMCA, where she was honored as the 2019 Volunteer of the Year, and she continues to serve on the YMCA of Central Texas Board of Directors. She previously served as President of the Round Rock Young Men’s Service League and now contributes at the national level as the organization’s Assurance Manager. Her past leadership roles include President of the Round Rock High School Cross Country Booster Club and Treasurer Advisor for the Round Rock Sweethearts. She is also a former member of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association and continues to remain active in numerous civic and professional groups, including the Round Rock Chamber of Commerce and the Professional Women of Williamson County. She currently serves on the Fellowship of Christian Athletes (FCA) Williamson County Board, the Breast Cancer Resource Center (BCRC) Board of Directors and is an engaged member of both the Rotary Club of Round Rock and the United Way for Greater Austin.

Kristin is a founding member of the Ascension Seton Williamson Women’s Development Board, a former President of the Chaparral Women’s Club, a past mentor for the Ascend Emerging Leaders Program, and a former Chair of the Round Rock Woman’s Club Soup and Bread Luncheon.

Her service to the City of Round Rock also includes previous appointments to the Planning and Zoning Commission and the Charter Review Commission.

A proud product of Round Rock ISD, Kristin graduated from Round Rock High School in 1994. She earned her B.S. in Communication Sciences from the University of Texas at Austin and her M.S. in Communication Sciences and Disorders from UT Dallas. Kristin retired from a rewarding 20-year career as a Pediatric Speech-Language Pathologist with Dell Children’s Pediatric Rehab in Cedar Park.

Kristin became a licensed Realtor® in 2021 and is an active member of the National Association of REALTORS®, the Austin Board of REALTORS®, and the Five Points Board of REALTORS®. She currently serves Central Texas through her real estate work with Team Price Real Estate.

Kristin and her husband, Sean, are the proud parents of three sons—Cade (22), Parker (19), and Zack (16).

### Hilda Montgomery, Place 6

![](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Web-Hilda_Montgomery-0026-Edit2.jpg)

[EMAIL HILDA MONTGOMERY](https://www.roundrocktexas.gov/city-about-round-rock/city-council/city-council-members/#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dpopup%3Aopen%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6IjYyMjc3MiIsInRvZ2dsZSI6ZmFsc2V9)

Hilda won a special election for Place 6 in December 2017.

Originally from Chicago, Hilda was recruited to Central Texas by Dell Computers to work as a manager in the factory on Braker Lane. She accumulated a wide-breath of experience working with various Dell products and Tech Support, prior to taking on a role as Project Manager.

Hilda has called Round Rock home since 1999, and still lives in the same neighborhood. An avid community volunteer, she has volunteered with numerous local groups and non-profits including Caritas, Round Rock Serving Center, Meals on Wheels and Special Olympics.

Hilda strongly believes in making a difference in peoples’ lives, and that we need to get back to governing for the people. Hilda cites inclusion and ensuring that the residents of Round Rock are involved with their city government as paramount.

Hilda holds a Bachelor’s degree from North Central College, Naperville, Ill.

Hilda spends her spare time enjoying the serenity of Round Rock’s nature trails, traveling, as well as listening to classic radio dramas.
